author: Ben Gao
title: 2020W-F-P2 question
question:
My answer to this practice problem was a little different from the solution, and I was wondering,
would my solution still be valid, and is it tail-recursive? Or is there something wrong with it?
the question:
 Design a function called longest-sequence that consumes a list of integers
and produces the longest sequence of consecutive integers that are each one
larger than the previous integer.  All of the following are examples of
 sequences of consecutive integers:
my answer:
student_answer:
@6
The solution is tail recursive and should work fine I think.
